title: Understanding the organization and its context
summary: Determine external/internal issues relevant to the AMS and whether climate change is a relevant issue.

title: Needs and expectations of stakeholders
summary: Identify relevant stakeholders, their requirements, which will be addressed, and impacts of assets/AMS on them.

title: Scope of the asset management system
summary: Define boundaries/applicability of the AMS, consider context and stakeholder needs, list the asset portfolio; document the scope.

title: Asset management system
summary: Establish, implement, maintain, and continually improve the AMS and its processes.

title: Decision-making framework
summary: Create and apply a framework to define value and decision criteria; consider context, stakeholders, scope, risks/opportunities.

title: Decision criteria
summary: Define criteria considering impact over time, complexity, urgency, and capability; effort proportional to these factors.

title: Methods, processes and tools
summary: Select methods/tools to evaluate options over life cycle, manage risk/opportunity, ensure information confidence, and support governance.

title: Leadership and commitment
summary: Top management ensures policy, scope, SAMP, objectives, resources, integration, results, awareness, continual improvement, criteria use, approvals.

title: Asset management policy
summary: Establish a suitable policy providing a framework for objectives; commit to requirements and continual improvement; document and communicate.

title: Roles, responsibilities and authorities
summary: Assign and communicate responsibilities to ensure conformity and reporting on performance to top management and stakeholders.

title: Planning – general (risks and opportunities)
summary: Determine risks/opportunities to assure results, prevent undesired effects, and drive continual improvement.

title: Actions to address risk
summary: Assess, evaluate, and treat risks to assets/AMS; plan actions, integrate into processes, and evaluate effectiveness; document.

title: Actions to address opportunities
summary: Capture and decide on opportunities; plan actions, integrate into processes, evaluate effectiveness; document.

title: Strategic Asset Management Plan (SAMP)
summary: Develop SAMP: decision framework, value definition, objectives, capability needs, timeframes, contingencies, improvement approach; align with finance; maintain.

title: Asset management objectives
summary: Set measurable, aligned objectives considering context, risks/opportunities, asset condition/performance/capabilities; monitor, communicate, review.

title: Planning to achieve objectives
summary: Maintain asset management plan(s) aligned with policy/SAMP; define actions, resources, roles, timelines, evaluation, documentation, lifecycle methods, implications, review.

title: Planning of changes
summary: Plan temporary/permanent changes and assess associated risks before implementation.

title: Resources
summary: Provide resources for establishing, implementing, maintaining, and improving the AMS and meeting objectives.

title: Competence
summary: Define, ensure, and periodically assess competence; take actions (train, hire, reassign); keep evidence.

title: Awareness
summary: Ensure people know the policy, their contribution, implications of nonconformity, and related risks/opportunities; evaluate effectiveness.

title: Communication
summary: Define what/when/with whom/how to communicate; consult stakeholders and evidence effectiveness.

title: Documented information – general
summary: Maintain required documentation for AMS effectiveness and legal/regulatory needs; extent depends on org complexity and asset criticality.

title: Creating/updating documents
summary: Ensure identification, format/media, and appropriate review/approval.

title: Control of documented information
summary: Control availability, suitability, protection, distribution, storage/preservation, change control, retention/disposition; control external docs.

title: Data and information
summary: Specify data needs/attributes/sources; plan collection/integration/quality/sharing; manage processes, sharing, and finance/non-finance alignment.

title: Knowledge
summary: Determine needed knowledge; make it accessible; retain, acquire, and update as requirements and trends change.

title: Operational planning and control (life cycle)
summary: Plan/implement/control life cycle processes; set criteria; monitor risks/opportunities; manage value across the life cycle; document as needed.

title: Control of change
summary: Control planned changes and review unintended consequences; mitigate adverse effects.

title: Externally provided processes/products/services
summary: Control suppliers/providers, define scope/interfaces/responsibilities/sharing, align with SAMP and plans; monitor per 9.1.

title: Monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation
summary: Define what/how/when to monitor/measure and when to analyze/evaluate; evidence results; evaluate assets/AMS performance; report; evaluate risk/opportunity management.

title: Internal audit – general
summary: Conduct internal audits to verify conformity and effectiveness.

title: Internal audit programme
summary: Plan and maintain audit programme (frequency, methods, responsibilities); define criteria/scope; ensure objectivity; report and act on findings; keep evidence.

title: Management review – general
summary: Top management reviews AMS at planned intervals for suitability, adequacy, effectiveness.

title: Management review inputs
summary: Include status of actions, changes in issues/stakeholders, performance trends, risk/opportunity profile, decision framework effectiveness, improvement opportunities.

title: Management review results
summary: Decide on improvements, resources, and changes to assets/AMS; keep evidence of results.

title: Continual improvement
summary: Continually improve assets, asset management, and the AMS to provide value.

title: Nonconformity and corrective action
summary: React, control/correct, deal with consequences; find causes; implement actions; review effectiveness; record evidence.

title: Predictive action
summary: Establish processes to predict needs, determine optimal intervention points, and required inputs (condition→performance/risk/cost, depreciation/value); integrate actions and report long-term effects.
